summary:
Germanic languages are spoken by around 515 million people worldwide, mainly in Europe and other continents. The most popular one is English, used by over 2 billion people. These languages come from an ancient language called Proto-Germanic, spoken in Scandinavia and Northern Europe.

There are three main groups: West, North, and East Germanic. English, German, and Dutch are the most widely spoken West Germanic languages. Swedish, Danish, and Norwegian are North Germanic. Gothic and Vandalic are examples of extinct East Germanic languages.

Today, there are 48 living Germanic languages, but many old ones are no longer used.
title: Germanic languages
